title: French In A Flash: Trout En Papillotte
summary: French In A Flash: Trout En Papillotte might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 659 calories, 74g of protein, and 29g of fat. For $8.8 per serving, this recipe covers 48% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 27 minutes. This recipe is typical of Mediterranean cuisine. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. If you have pea shoots, lemon, fennel bulb, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the rosemary you could follow this main course with the Raspberry Brie Dessert Pizza with Rosemary and Candied Pecans as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes include Trout en Papillotte or the Real Reason French Women Donâ€™t Get Fat, French In A Flash: Purple Potato-crusted Trout A La Francaise, and French in a Flash: Olivey French Lentil and Barley Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: French works really well with Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Chateau Bellevue Peycharneau Bordeaux Superieur with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Bellevue Peycharneau Bordeaux Superieur
productMatches.description: A beautiful, shiny and elegant ruby ??color. Rich and powerful nose of red fruits, with vanilla and toasted notes. Delicate on the palate, woody, with aromas of liquorice and red fruits, finely spiced, with a long and tannic finish.
